definition: to rush/to charge/to dash/to break through/to temper oneself (through battling hardships)
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: Hearn fastened the vine about his belt, and stepped out into the rapids.
sentences.chinese: 俟思把藤索在腰里系好，闯进激流。

sentences.english: Going into the tana away, west mother forbade it, get rid of him.
sentences.chinese: 塔纳要闯进去带走帕莱，西瓦母亲不允，赶走了他。

sentences.english: Why not have the Ivory Coast as the first African team in the Final?
sentences.chinese: 科特迪瓦为什么不能是第一个闯进决赛圈的球队呢？

sentences.english: Suddenly, several officers broke into the hospital, to protect the cost.
sentences.chinese: 突然，几个官兵闯进了医馆，要保护费。

sentences.english: We can't have a lot of people barging in.
sentences.chinese: 我们不允许很多人闯进来。

sentences.english: The manager stormed into my office,waving a piece of paper about.
sentences.chinese: 经理怒气冲冲闯进我的办公室，手里挥着一份文件。

sentences.english: He nearly ran into a large man who suddenly came in through the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 他差点与一位突然闯进的大个子男人撞个满怀。

sentences.english: A masked man ran amok in the town square.
sentences.chinese: 一个戴面具的人杀气腾腾地闯进了市政广场。

sentences.english: Suddenly the door opened and a group of children burst in.
sentences.chinese: 门突然打开，闯进了一群孩子。

sentences.english: He came into my study one winter night and caught me quite unawares.
sentences.chinese: 他在一个冬夜闯进我的书房，这相当令我惊讶。

sentences.english: The central control is within the Guardians compound. It's impossible to break in.
sentences.chinese: 控制中心就在卫队监狱内，我们很难闯进去的。

sentences.english: A reporter tried to break in, but was checked by the guard.
sentences.chinese: 一名记者试图闯进去，但被门口警卫挡住了。

sentences.english: The intruder whipped out a knife from his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 闯进来的人突然从他的口袋里掏出一把刀来。

sentences.english: And two deer were caught on tape after breaking into a New Haven donut shop.
sentences.chinese: 两只鹿闯进一间新天堂甜甜圈的时候被抓拍到了。

sentences.english: A stranger barged into the room while they were having a meeting.
sentences.chinese: 他们开会时一个陌生人闯进了房间。

sentences.english: The farmer came after the intruders with a big stick .
sentences.chinese: 农夫拿着大棒追赶闯进来的人。

definition: to set foot in/to tread (in or on)/to walk into
to get sth open by tapping or striking it/(figuratively, when followed by sth like ∼的大門|∼的大门) to open the door to ~/to gain access to ~
lit. to meet face to face on a narrow path (idiom)/fig. enemies or rivals meet face to face
to rush/to charge/to dash/to break through/to temper oneself (through battling hardships)
to break into/to force one's way into/to barge into
to break the door down and enter (idiom)
